title: `$args`
blurb: Returns one or more arguments passed to the function that calls it, based on their indices.

title: `abs`
blurb: Returns the absolute value of `@x`.

title: `absolute`
blurb: Generates audio process operation for computing the absolute value of a buffer signal.

title: `acos`
blurb: Returns the arc cosine value of `@x`.

title: `acosh`
blurb: Returns the inverse hyperbolic cosine of `@x`

title: `addmarker`
blurb: Inserts a marker into the transcription score, given an onset time and, optionally, a list of names and/or role associated with that marker.

title: `alter`
blurb: Returns the difference, in tones, between the pitch value of `@x` and its diatonic pitch name.

title: `analyze`
blurb: Applies a sequence of audio analysis operations to the input buffer, via audio descriptors.

title: `apply`
blurb: Calls another function by passing it individual parameters expressed as two _lllls_, one for arguments passed by position, the other for arguments passed by name.

title: `approx`
blurb: Returns approximated value of `@pitch` to the nearest tone division

title: `argsort`
blurb: Returns the indices that would sort an input llll in ascending order.

title: `arithmser`
blurb: Returns an arithmetic series, understood as a list of evenly spaced numeric values.

title: `asin`
blurb: Returns the arc sine value of `@x`.

title: `asinh`
blurb: Returns the hyperbolic arc sine value of `@x`.

title: `atan2`
blurb: Returns the arctangent of `@x` and `@y`.

title: `atan`
blurb: Returns the arc tangent value of `@x`.

title: `atanh`
blurb: Returns the hyperbolic arc tangent value of `@x`.

title: `atodb`
blurb: Linear amplitude to decibels conversion.

title: `autoscale`
blurb: Applies auto-scaling normalization to a llll.

title: `barkbands`
blurb: Generates audio descriptor to compute the Bark bands of a spectrum.

title: `bessel`
blurb: Returns the Bessel function of the first kind of given `@order` at point `@x`.

title: `bfcc`
blurb: Generates audio descriptor to compute the bark-frequency cepstrum coefficients of a spectrum.

title: `biquad`
blurb: Generates audio process operation for applying biquad filtering to a buffer.

title: `bpf`
blurb: Formats an numeric list into a breakpoint function, in the form of [ `<x>` `<y>` `<slope>` ] tuples.

title: `buf2ptracks`
blurb: Converts a buffer into partial tracks via analysis, consisting of a _llll_ with the keys `frequencies`, `magnitudes`, and `phases`, structured as follows:

title: `buf2samps`
blurb: Buffer to samples conversion.

title: `c2r`
blurb: Cents to ratio conversion.

title: `cartesianprod`
blurb: Returns the cartesian product of the sublists of an _llll_.

title: `ceil`
blurb: Returns rounded up value of `@x` to the nearest integer.

title: `cents`
blurb: Converts the value of `@x` to MIDI cents.

title: `choose`
blurb: Choose randomly one or more elements from a list, with optional probability weights.

title: `chordsdetection`
blurb: Generates audio descriptor to perform chord estimation on a buffer.

title: `classify`
blurb: Arranges elements into classes.

title: `clicks`
blurb: Generates a buffer containing a set of clicks at specific onsets.

title: `clip`
blurb: Generates audio process operation for applying hard-clip distortion to a buffer.

title: `comb`
blurb: Returns all the k-combinations of an _llll_ for a range of `k`.

title: `contains`
blurb: Returns a summary of the data types contained in an _llll_.

title: `cos`
blurb: Returns the cosine value of `@x`.

title: `cosh`
blurb: Returns the hyperbolic cosine value of `@x`.

title: `createtable`
blurb: Instantiates a [SQLite3](https://www.sqlitetutorial.net/) table given a list, where each element is expected to be a list of key-value pairs.

title: `createtree`
blurb: Creates a k-dimensional tree for optimized nearest-neighbor search of multidimensional data.

title: `crop`
blurb: Generates audio process operation for cropping a buffer.

title: `cycle`
blurb: Generates a sinusoidal oscillator as a buffer.

title: `dbtoa`
blurb: Decibels to linear amplitude conversion.

title: `dcfilter`
blurb: Generates audio process operation for removing DC offset from a buffer.

title: `degrade`
blurb: Generates audio process operation for reducing sampling rate and bit-depth of a buffer.

title: `degree`
blurb: Converts a pitch or MIDI cents value to C-based diatonic scale degree.

title: `delace`
blurb: Deinterlaces an _llll_ into a given number of _lllls_.

title: `den`
blurb: Returns the denominator of `@x`

title: `depth`
blurb: Returns the depth of input _llll_.

title: `derive`
blurb: Computes the derivative of a breakpoint function.

title: `diff`
blurb: Returns the set difference of two _lllls_.

title: `directin`
blurb: Receives data during evaluation from one direct inlet.

title: `directout`
blurb: Outputs data from one or more direct outlets.

title: `dissonance`
blurb: Generates audio descriptor to compute the sensory dissonance of a buffer.

title: `divide`
blurb: Generates audio process operation for performing division on a buffer.

title: `dr2r`
blurb: Takes a list of ratios and an optional starting value, and returns the cumulative multiplication between adjacent elements, as a list.

title: `dx2x`
blurb: Takes a list of differences—i.e., deltas—and an optional starting value, and returns the cumulative sum between adjacent elements, as a list.

title: `dynamics`
blurb: Generates audio process operation for applying simple compression to a buffer.

title: `effectiveduration`
blurb: Generates audio descriptor to compute the effective duration of an envelope signal.

title: `energy`
blurb: Generates audio descriptor to compute the energy of a buffer.

title: `energyband`
blurb: Generates audio descriptor to compute energy in a given frequency band of a spectrum including both start and stop cutoff frequencies.

title: `enharm`
blurb: Given some pitch `@x` and a diatonic step `@y` relative to `@x`, returns the corresponding enharmonic value or respelling of that `@x`.

title: `envelope`
blurb: Generates an audio envelope as a buffer, given a single number or a breakpoint function.

title: `envmaxtime`
blurb: Generates audio descriptor to extract the time at which the global maxima of the buffer's envelope occurs.

title: `envmintime`
blurb: Generates audio descriptor to extract the time at which the global minima of the buffer's envelope occurs.

title: `exists`
blurb: Checks if a file or folder exists.

title: `exp2`
blurb: Raises 2 to the power of `@x`.

title: `exp`
blurb: Raises the constant `e` (`~2.71828`) to the power of `@x`.

title: `expand`
blurb: Modifies offset and duration of a buffer, such that it uses the full length of its reference buffer.

title: `export`
blurb: Exports the rendered output as either an audio (`.wav`, `.aif`, `.aiff`, `.mp3`), MIDI (`.mid`,`.midi`), or roll (`.llll`) file, given a output path.

title: `ezsampler`
blurb: Generates a buffer given pitch, duration, and velocity values, and an optional list representing a sampler key map.

title: `f2mc`
blurb: Converts all the numbers in an _llll_ from frequency to MIDI cents, with optional reference frequency and pitch.

title: `fade`
blurb: Generates audio process operation for applying fadein/fadeout to a buffer.

title: `find`
blurb: Retrieves items from an _llll_, along with their addresses.

title: `findaddrs`
blurb: Retrieves the addresses of items from an _llll_.

title: `finditems`
blurb: Retrieves items from an _llll_.

title: `flat`
blurb: Flattens depth levels of an _llll_.

title: `float`
blurb: Casts value of `@x` as a `float`.

title: `floor`
blurb: Rounds down the value of `@x` to the nearest integer.

title: `flux`
blurb: Generates audio descriptor to compute the spectral flux of a buffer.

title: `fmod`
blurb: Returns `@x` modulo `@y`

title: `fold`
blurb: Triangular function.

title: `freeverb`
blurb: Generates audio process operation for applying reverb to a buffer.

title: `freqshift`
blurb: Generates audio process operation for applying frequency shifting to a buffer.

title: `fromdiffs`
blurb: Generates audio process operation to perform discrete integration of a buffer.

title: `gain`
blurb: Generates audio process operation for modifying a buffer's gain.

title: `gcd`
blurb: Computes the greatest common denominator of a list of integers.

title: `geomser`
blurb: Returns a geomethric series, understood as a list where the ratio between adjacent elements is constant.

title: `getchannels`
blurb: Extracts one or more buffer channels as individual buffers.

title: `getchar`
blurb: Given a symbol and one or more indices, it returns the characters corresponding to each index.

title: `getkey`
blurb: Returns value associated with an llll key.

title: `getmediafiles`
blurb: Returns a list of built-in media files in **bellplay~**.

title: `groove`
blurb: Audio processing operation for applying variable-rate sample playback to a buffer.

title: `group`
blurb: Groups elements in sublists according to a regular size pattern.

title: `hanning`
blurb: Generates a hanning window as a numeric list.

title: `hoadecode`
blurb: Generates audio process operation for decoding higher-order ambisonic buffers for a set of loudspeakers or for binaural listening

title: `hoaencode`
blurb: Generates audio process operation for panning the input buffer and encode it as a higher-order ambisonic buffer

title: `hypot`
blurb: Returns the hypotenuse of `@x` and `@y`

title: `importaudio`
blurb: Imports an audio file (`.wav`, `.aif`, `.aiff`, `.mp3`) as a buffer, given a file path.

title: `importmidi`
blurb: Imports a midi file, as a list of events, each with the following keys:

title: `inharmonicity`
blurb: Generates audio descriptor to calculate the inharmonicity of a buffer.

title: `initurn`
blurb: Initializes a new unique random number generator (URN), given a size and a URN identifier.

title: `inlet`
blurb: Returns the number of the inlet that triggered the computation.

title: `insert`
blurb: Inserts one or more elements in a list according to their positions.

title: `inspect`
blurb: Adds input buffer to the buffer inspector window, which opens up once the script evaluation is over, displaying relevant buffer information—useful for debugging buffers.

title: `int`
blurb: Casts value of `@x` as an `int`.

title: `integrate`
blurb: Computes the integral of a breakpoint function.

title: `interrupt`
blurb: Disables communication between the current script and the **bellplay~** application, interrupting any backend-dependent operations.

title: `intersection`
blurb: Returns the intersection of two _lllls_.

title: `is`
blurb: Returns the data type of the input, as one of the following symbols:

title: `isnan`
blurb: Checks if the input argument is strictly a nan—i.e., 'not a number'—value.

title: `join`
blurb: Generates audio process operation for concatenating one or more buffers to the processed buffer.

title: `larm`
blurb: Generates audio descriptor to estimate the long-term loudness of a buffer.

title: `lcm`
blurb: Computes the least common multiple of a list of integers.

title: `left`
blurb: Returns the left part of an _llll_ relative to an index.

title: `length`
blurb: Returns the number of elements in the root level of an _llll_.

title: `log10`
blurb: Returns the logarithm base 10 of `@x`

title: `log2`
blurb: Returns the logarithm base 2 of `@x`

title: `log`
blurb: Returns the natural logarithm of `@x`

title: `logattack`
blurb: Generates audio descriptor to compute the log (base 10) of the attack time of buffer's envelope.

title: `makepitch`
blurb: Generates a `pitch` value, given a `@degree`, `@octave`, and `@alter`

title: `makepitchsc`
blurb: Generates a pitch, given a number of `@steps` along the C-based diatonic scale, and the desired MIDIcents value in `@cents`.

title: `map`
blurb: Transforms an _llll_ element-wise, according to a given lambda function.

title: `mapkey`
blurb: Modifies an existing `llll` key via a lambda function.

title: `markov2seq`
blurb: Generates a sequence using a given Markov transition matrix.

title: `max`
blurb: Returns the maximum value between `@x` an `@y`.

title: `maximum`
blurb: Returns the smallest number in an _llll_.

title: `maxmagfreq`
blurb: Generates audio descriptor to compute the frequency with the largest magnitude in a spectrum.

title: `mc2chroma`
blurb: Midicents to chroma vector conversion.

title: `mc2f`
blurb: Converts all the numbers (assumed to be MIDI cents) and pitches in an _llll_ to frequency, with optional reference frequency and pitch.

title: `mc2pc`
blurb: midicent to pitch class conversion.

title: `mean`
blurb: Returns the mean value of a numeric list.

title: `median`
blurb: Returns the median element of a numeric list.

title: `mfcc`
blurb: Generates audio descriptor to compute the mel-frequency cepstrum coefficients of a buffer's spectrum.

title: `min`
blurb: Returns the minimum value between `@x` an `@y`.

title: `minimum`
blurb: Returns the smallest number in an _llll_.

title: `minmax`
blurb: Returns an _llll_ composed of four elements, respectively the minimum value in the _llll_, its address, the maximum value and its address.

title: `minus`
blurb: Generates audio process operation for performing subtraction on a buffer.

title: `mix`
blurb: Generates audio process operation for mixing multiple buffers.

title: `mixdown`
blurb: Generates audio process operation for mixing down (or up) the number of channels of a buffer.

title: `mod`
blurb: Returns `@x` modulo `@y`

title: `multiply`
blurb: Generates audio process operation for performing multiplication on a buffer.

title: `nearest`
blurb: Given a target number, finds the nearest value in a numeric list via binary search.

title: `noise`
blurb: Generates white noise as a buffer.

title: `normalize`
blurb: Generates audio process operation for normalizing the amplitude of a buffer.

title: `nth`
blurb: Returns one or more elements from an _llll_ according to its address.

title: `num`
blurb: Returns the numerator of `@x`.

title: `octave`
blurb: Returns the pitch octave level of `@x`.

title: `octreduce`
blurb: Reduces ratios to fit within the 1-2 range.

title: `onepole`
blurb: Generates audio process operation for applying single-pole lowpass or highpass filtering to a buffer.

title: `onsetdetection`
blurb: Generates audio descriptor to compute buffer onsets, given various onset detection functions.

title: `onsets`
blurb: Generates audio descriptor to compute the onset positions in a buffer.

title: `outlet`
blurb: Assigns values to extra outlets, and returns the last (or only) value assigned.

title: `overdrive`
blurb: Generates audio process operation for applying soft-clip distortion to a buffer.

title: `panning`
blurb: Generates audio process operation for applying 1-D panning to a buffer.

title: `parsepath`
blurb: Parses a given path into key-value pairs for the following properties:

title: `paulfreeze`
blurb: Generates audio process operation for freezing a buffer.

title: `paulstretch`
blurb: Generates audio process operation for applying time-stretching to a buffer.

title: `pcdiff`
blurb: Signed pitch class difference.

title: `perm`
blurb: Returns one or more distinct permutations of an _llll_.

title: `phasor`
blurb: Generates a unipolar ramp oscillator as a buffer.

title: `pitch`
blurb: Casts value of `@x` as `pitch`.

title: `pitchdiff`
blurb: Given a list of target midicents and/or pitch classes, returns the signed difference between a pitch in midicents and the nearest midicent/pitch class target.

title: `pitchmelodia`
blurb: Generates audio descriptor to estimate the fundamental frequency corresponding to the melody of a monophonic music signal based on the MELODIA algorithm.

title: `pitchyin`
blurb: Generates audio descriptor to estimate the fundamental frequency of a monophonic buffer.

title: `plus`
blurb: Generates audio process operation for performing addition on a buffer.

title: `pong`
blurb: Generates audio process operation for applying range limiting to a buffer.

title: `pow`
blurb: Returns the value of `@base` to the power of `@exponent`.

title: `power`
blurb: Generates audio process operation for performing exponentiation on a buffer.

title: `primeser`
blurb: Return sequences of primes.

title: `print`
blurb: Prints an _llll_ in the Max console.

title: `process`
blurb: Applies a sequence of DSP operations to the input buffer, prior to rendering, via audio processing operations.

title: `prod`
blurb: Returns the product of the elements in an _llll_.

title: `ptracks2buf`
blurb: Converts a partial track analysis, which can be generated via the `buf2ptracks` function, into a buffer.

title: `querytable`
blurb: Performs a [SQLite3](https://www.sqlitetutorial.net/) query on previously created tables.

title: `querytree`
blurb: Given a k-dimensional tree and a target point with the same dimensionality, returns the index position of the nearest neighbor in that tree.

title: `r2c`
blurb: Ratio to cents conversion.

title: `r2dr`
blurb: Takes a list of ratios or factors and returns the quotients between adjacent elements.

title: `r2mc`
blurb: Ratio to midicent conversion.

title: `r2pc`
blurb: Ratio to pitch class conversion, assuming octave equivalence.

title: `rampsmooth`
blurb: Generates audio process operation for applying rampsmoothing to a buffer.

title: `rand`
blurb: Random floating point number generator.

title: `random`
blurb: Returns a random integer between `@x` and `@y`.

title: `randosc`
blurb: Generates a random oscillator as a buffer.

title: `rat`
blurb: Casts value of `@x` as `rat`.

title: `read`
blurb: Read `.txt` or native `.llll` data.

title: `readfolder`
blurb: Returns a list of file paths in specified folder directory.

title: `rect`
blurb: Generates a bipolar, anti-aliased rectangular (pulse) oscillator as a buffer.

title: `reduce`
blurb: Applies cumulatively a binary function to all the elements in an _llll_.

title: `render`
blurb: Triggers audio rendering of all transcribed buffers via `transcribe`, and returns the rendered buffer.

title: `repeat`
blurb: Generates audio process operation for repeating a buffer.

title: `resample`
blurb: Generates audio process operation for applying stretching/pitch shifting a buffer via resampling.

title: `retune`
blurb: Generates audio process operation for applying autotune-like pitch retuning to a buffer.

title: `rev`
blurb: Reverses the contents of an _llll_.

title: `revbpf`
blurb: Reverses a breakpoint function.

title: `reverse`
blurb: Generates audio process operation for reversing a buffer.

title: `rhythm`
blurb: Audio descriptor for extract the beat positions and estimate their confidence as well as tempo in bpm for a buffer.

title: `right`
blurb: Returns the right part of an _llll_ relative to an index.

title: `rolloff`
blurb: Generates audio descriptor to compute the roll-off frequency of a spectrum.

title: `rot`
blurb: Rotates the contents of an _llll_.

title: `round`
blurb: Rounds the value of `@x` to the nearest integer.

title: `rounding`
blurb: Generates audio process operation for applying signal rounding to a buffer.

title: `rubberband`
blurb: Generates audio process operation for applying rubberband pitch-shifting/time-stretching to a buffer.

title: `samplebpf`
blurb: Samples an interpolated value from a breakpoint function, given a list of normalized indices.

title: `samplelist`
blurb: Samples an interpolated value from a numeric list given a normalized index.

title: `samps2buf`
blurb: Samples to buffer conversion.

title: `saw`
blurb: Generates a bipolar, anti-aliased sawtooth oscillator as a buffer.

title: `scale`
blurb: Scales an input value or list from a given range to another, with optional slope for non-linear scaling.

title: `scaling`
blurb: Generates audio process operation for applying amplitude scaling to a buffer.

title: `scoreconfig`
blurb: Configures the score appearance, such as the clefs, voice names, tone division, etc.

title: `scramble`
blurb: Shuffles randomly the elements of an _llll_.

title: `scrub`
blurb: Generates audio process operation for scrubbing through a buffer.

title: `seq2markov`
blurb: Constructs a Markov chain from a given sequence of data.

title: `setkey`
blurb: Sets the value of a given key in a `llll`.

title: `setseed`
blurb: Sets the random seed for the `xrand`, `xrandom`, `xchoose`, `xscramble`, and `urn` functions.

title: `sgn`
blurb: Returns the sign of `@x`.

title: `sin`
blurb: Returns the sine value of `@x`.

title: `sinh`
blurb: Returns the hyperbolic sine of `@x`.

title: `slice`
blurb: Divides `@llll` into two sublists according to a split point.

title: `sort`
blurb: Returns a sorted `@llll`.

title: `sortbykeys`
blurb: Sorts `llll` elements by a given set of keys.

title: `soundtouch`
blurb: Generates audio process operation for applying soundtouch pitch-shifting/time-stretching to a buffer.

title: `spectralcentroid`
blurb: Generates audio descriptor to calculate the spectral centroid of a buffer, defined as the 'center of mass' of the spectrum, in Hertz.

title: `spectralflatness`
blurb: Generates audio descriptor to calculate the spectral flatness of a buffer, defined as the ratio between the spectrum's geometric mean and arithmetic mean.

title: `spectralkurtosis`
blurb: Generates audio descriptor to compute the spectral kurtosis of a buffer.

title: `spectralskewness`
blurb: Generates audio descriptor to compute the spectral skewness of a buffer.

title: `spectralspread`
blurb: Generates audio descriptor to compute the spectral spread of a buffer.

title: `spectralvariance`
blurb: Generates audio descriptor to compute the spectral variance of a buffer.

title: `spectrum`
blurb: Generates audio descriptor to compute the magnitude spectrum of a buffer.

title: `splitbuf`
blurb: Splits a buffer into multiple segments.

title: `sqrt`
blurb: Returns the square root of `@x`.

title: `squareroot`
blurb: Generates audio process operation for computing the square root of a buffer signal.

title: `strongdecay`
blurb: Generates audio descriptor to compute the strong decay of a buffer.

title: `strongpeak`
blurb: Generates audio descriptor to compute the strong peak of a buffer, defined as the ratio between the spectrum's maximum peak's magnitude and the 'bandwidth' of the peak above a threshold—i.e., half its amplitude.

title: `subs`
blurb: Substitutes one or more elements of a list according to their positions.

title: `sum`
blurb: Returns the sum of the elements in `@llll`.

title: `symdiff`
blurb: Returns the symmetric difference of two _lllls_.

title: `symlen`
blurb: Returns the length of symbol.

title: `tan`
blurb: Returns the tangent of `@x`.

title: `tanh`
blurb: Returns the hyperbolic tangent of `@x`.

title: `teeth`
blurb: Generates audio process operation for applying comb filtering to a buffer, with feedforward and feedback delay control.

title: `temporalcentroid`
blurb: Generates audio descriptor to calculate the temporal centroid of a buffer, defined as the point in time that is a temporal balancing point of the sound's energy.

title: `temporalflatness`
blurb: Generates audio descriptor to calculate the temporal flatness of a buffer, defined as the ratio between the buffer envelope's geometric mean and arithmetic mean.

title: `temporalkurtosis`
blurb: Generates audio descriptor to compute the temporal kurtosis of a buffer.

title: `temporalskewness`
blurb: Generates audio descriptor to compute the temporal skewness of a buffer.

title: `temporalspread`
blurb: Generates audio descriptor to compute the temporal spread of a buffer.

title: `temporalvariance`
blurb: Generates audio descriptor to compute the temporal variance of a buffer.

title: `thin`
blurb: Removes the duplicates from an _llll_.

title: `thispath`
blurb: Returns the path of the current script, as either a symbol or a parsed `llll` path.

title: `timesquash`
blurb: Generates audio process operation for applying timesquash time compression to a buffer.

title: `todiffs`
blurb: Generates audio process operation to perform discrete differentiation of a buffer.

title: `tonalkey`
blurb: Generates audio descriptor to perform tonal key signature estimation on a buffer.

title: `tosymbol`
blurb: Casts input value as a symbol.

title: `trans`
blurb: Returns the matrix transposition of an _llll_.

title: `transcribe`
blurb: Adds input buffer to the rendering sequence.

title: `tri`
blurb: Generates a bipolar, anti-aliased triangular oscillator as a buffer.

title: `triangle`
blurb: Generates a triangular/ramp oscillator as a buffer.

title: `trim`
blurb: Generates audio process operation for applying silence-based trimming to a buffer.

title: `trunc`
blurb: Returns the truncated value of `@x`.

title: `union`
blurb: Returns the union of two _lllls_.

title: `urn`
blurb: Returns a unique random number for a given URN identifier.

title: `wavesetrepeat`
blurb: Generates audio process operation for applying waveset repetition to a buffer.

title: `wavesetshuffle`
blurb: Generates audio process operation for applying waveset shuffling to a buffer.

title: `waveshape`
blurb: Generates audio process operation for waveshaping a buffer.

title: `window`
blurb: Generates audio process operation for applying a windowing function to a buffer.

title: `wrap`
blurb: Returns an _llll_ wrapped in parentheses, thus raising its overall depth.

title: `write`
blurb: Writes data into disk in either `.txt` or native `.llll` format.

title: `x2dx`
blurb: Takes a list of numbers and returns the differences—i.e., deltas—between adjacent elements.

title: `xchoose`
blurb: Choose randomly one or more elements from a list, with optional probability weights.

title: `xrand`
blurb: Seed-based random floating point number generator.

title: `xrandom`
blurb: Seed-based random integer number generator.

title: `xscramble`
blurb: Seed-based random shuffling of elements.

title: `zerocrossingrate`
blurb: Generates audio descriptor to compute the zero-crossing rate of a buffer, defined as the number of sign changes between consecutive signal values divided by the total number of values.

title: Acknowledgments
blurb: **bellplay~** relies on several key tools and frameworks:

title: Audio corpora with SQL tables
blurb: This tutorial demonstrates how to create an in-memory, queryable corpus of audio buffers by leveraging the `createtable` and `querytable` functions.

title: Audio Descriptor Modes
blurb: When analyzing buffers, we can specify the output format for many of the available audio descriptors.

title: Audio Descriptors
blurb: One of the core features in **bellplay~** is our ability to analyze buffers to extract relevant information.

title: Audio Mosaicing
blurb: An example of basic [audio mosaicking](https://www.francoispachet.fr/musaicing/) in **bellplay\~**, where a target audio file is reconstructed using segments drawn from a small audio corpus.

title: Audio Resynthesis
blurb: A simple demonstration of granular quasi-resynthesis via partial tracks, where an sound is used to guide the behavior of sinusoidal grains.

title: Automation
blurb: In many cases, we will want to have some kind of DAW-style automation of certain parameters when generating or processing audio in our scripts.

title: Basic Granulation
blurb: An example of basic audio granulation, where short audio.

title: Basic Sampling
blurb: In **bellplay~**, the `ezsampler` function provides a minimal but flexible interface for mapping symbolic pitch and velocity information to audio buffers.

title: Basic Workflow
blurb: In **bellplay~**, the basic building block of our scripts is the _buffer_.

title: Buffer Keys
blurb: As mentioned in earlier tutorials, buffers in **bellplay~** are simply nested lists of [key-value pairs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Name–value_pair).

title: Buffer Processing
blurb: One of the core features of **bellplay~** is the ability to dynamically and flexibly apply chains of DSP algorithms to our buffers.

title: Buffer-based Parameters
blurb: This tutorial shows how to use buffers to control audio parameters.

title: Caching Data
blurb: In **bellplay~**, computation-heavy operations such as building large corpora, analyzing lots of audio data, and more, can be take a very long time, thus making it more tedious to experiment with our scripts every time we run them.

title: credits
blurb: I’m [Felipe Tovar-Henao](https://felipe-tovar-henao.com), and I develop and maintain **bellplay~**.

title: Envelope-aware Temporal Alignment
blurb: This example demonstrates how to align the envelopes of different audio samples based on their peak amplitude times.

title: Exporting
blurb: Although the **bellplay~** graphical user-interface (GUI) allows us to export the final output of each script, it's sometimes useful being able to programmatically do the same through our scripts.

title: Feature-driven Sampling
blurb: This tutorial shows how to build [k-dimensional trees](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/K-d_tree) to efficiently perform feature-based search on buffers.

title: Feedback Synthesis
blurb: This code demonstrates a feedback-based synthesis technique, where buffers are routed back into their own processing chain to create a rich, evolving drone.

title: Frequently Asked Questions
blurb: Yes—some familiarity with programming concepts is recommended.

title: Generating Keymaps
blurb: This example automatically generates a custom keymap given a list of audio file paths:

title: Glissando texture
blurb: An example of using time-varying resampling to generate a polyphonic texture.

title: Importing Audio
blurb: In **bellplay~** we can also generate buffers by importing our own audio files into our scripts.

title: Importing MIDI
blurb: **bellplay~** supports importing MIDI files (`.mid` or `.midi`) into our scripts, each described as a list of events.

title: Inspecting Buffers
blurb: An essential part of writing code is being able to debug unwanted or unexpected behaviors.

title: Installation
blurb: To run **bellplay~**, you can either:

title: Introduction
blurb: **bellplay~** is a framework and software for offline algorithmic audio in the `bell` programming language.

title: License
blurb: **bellplay~** is distributed under the terms of the **GNU General Public License version 3 (GPL-3.0)**.

title: Markers
blurb: Sometimes it's useful to include markers in the transcription.

title: Markov Music Generation
blurb: This script illustrates how to construct and use an nth-order [Markov model](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Markov_model) from MIDI data in **bellplay~** for generative music.

title: MIDI Retuning
blurb: An example of JI-based retuning of MIDI events.

title: More Audio Features
blurb: This tutorial provides an additional example for using buffer analysis features for audio processing.

title: Multi-rendering
blurb: This tutorial demonstrates a very simple but consequential feature in **bellplay~** — namely, the ability to reuse rendered buffers multiple times to further refine and sculpt the final output into complex and intricate sounds.

title: Post-rendering Processing
blurb: Sometimes it can be more useful or desirable to apply processing to the entire output, instead of processing each buffer individually.

title: Randomness
blurb: Randomness is frequently used in algorithmic music to introduce variation and unpredictability.

title: Rendering
blurb: Similar to the transcription stage, the rendering stage allows us to define important aspects about the final output.

title: Score Formatting and Appearance
blurb: Depending on what you're doing, you might want to have more control over what the score transcription looks like.

title: Support
blurb: If you're using **bellplay~** and want to support its development:

title: Temporal Quantization
blurb: A basic example of temporal quantization, where transient-based segments are temporally shifted to align with a rhythmic grid.

title: Transcription
blurb: When transcribing buffers, we get to specify essential information about how each buffer fits within the final output.

title: Variable Declarations
blurb: When writing code, it's good practice to use descriptive variable names.

title: Waveshaping Buffers
blurb: A basic example of waveshaping in **bellplay~**, using a randomly generated breakpoint function.
